results.title: Still Undecided
results.abstract: The majorities in the House and the Senate remain uncalled. Here’s what we know.

media.caption: John Fetterman declaring victory in Pittsburgh.

results.byline: By Sheera Frenkel, Adam Satariano and Ryan Mac
results.title: Meta Lays Off More Than 11,000 Employees
results.abstract: The parent of Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp reduced its work force by 13 percent and extended a hiring freeze through the first quarter of next year.

media.caption: Mark Zuckerberg, Meta’s chief executive, met with executives on Tuesday about the layoffs.
media.copyright: Pete Marovich for The New York Times

results.title: Five Takeaways From a Red Wave That Didn’t Reach the Shore
results.abstract: Democrats showed up, Trump-backed candidates underperformed and inflation wasn’t the whole story: Here are last night’s lessons.

media.caption: Patrons watch election news at a Manhattan restaurant on Tuesday.
media.copyright: Brittainy Newman for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections;Boebert, Lauren;House of Representatives;Republican Party;Colorado
results.title: The Republican provocateur Lauren Boebert is in an unexpectedly tight race in Colorado.
results.abstract: A freshman House member, Ms. Boebert, 35, was facing a stiff challenge from Adam Frisch, a Democrat.

media.caption: Representative Lauren Boebert of Colorado at the Conservative Political Action Conference in Dallas in August.
media.copyright: Emil Lippe for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Student Athlete Compensation;Social Media;Women and Girls;Gymnastics;Basketball (College);Advertising and Marketing;VanDerveer, Tara;Dunne, Olivia (2002- );Jones, Haley (2001- );Instagram Inc;TikTok (ByteDance);Louisiana State University;Stanford University
results.title: New Endorsements for College Athletes Resurface an Old Concern: Sex Sells
results.abstract: Female college athletes are making millions thanks to their large social media followings. But some who have fought for equity in women’s sports worry that their brand building is regressive.

media.caption: Olivia Dunne, a gymnast at Louisiana State, earns over $1 million annually in endorsements. “That is something I’m proud of,” she said, adding that most female athletes will not advance to a pro league after college.
media.copyright: Annie Flanagan for The New York Times

results.byline: By Michael C. Bender and Maggie Haberman
results.title: Trump Hoped for a Celebration but Did Not Have Much to Cheer
results.abstract: The former president endorsed roughly 300 candidates in the midterm elections. With votes still being counted, those in competitive races appeared to have mixed results.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump speaking Tuesday at an election night party at his Mar-a-Lago resort in Palm Beach, Fla.
media.copyright: Josh Ritchie for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2024;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;DeSantis, Ron
results.title: Trump Threatens to Reveal Unflattering Information About DeSantis if He Runs
results.abstract: “I know more about him than anybody other than perhaps his wife,” the former president reportedly said.

media.caption: Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida spoke at a rally in Hialeah, Fla., on Monday.
media.copyright: Scott McIntyre for The New York Times

results.byline: By Michael C. Bender and Maggie Haberman
results.title: Trump Under Fire From Within G.O.P. After Midterms
results.abstract: “Republicans have followed Donald Trump off the side of a cliff,” a longtime adviser said.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump at his election night party at Mar-a-Lago in Florida.

results.adx_keywords: Virtual Currency;High Net Worth Individuals;Computers and the Internet;Social Media;Bitcoin (Currency);Bankman-Fried, Sam;Zhao, Changpeng;Binance;Coinbase Inc;HK FTX Trading Ltd (Futures Exchange)
results.title: Binance Pulls Out of Deal to Acquire Rival Crypto Exchange FTX
results.abstract: The rapid collapse of FTX, built by the billionaire Sam Bankman-Fried, suggests that no company in the freewheeling, loosely regulated crypto industry is safe.

media.caption: Sam Bankman-Fried, the head of FTX, was seen as one of the most reliable leaders of the crypto industry.
media.copyright: Lam Yik Fei for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Eclipses;Moon;Earth;Space and Astronomy
results.title: A Total Lunar Eclipse in Early Tuesday Skies
results.abstract: Those who woke up early to head to the polls on Tuesday, got a shot at seeing the moon darken as it fell into Earth’s shadow.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Absentee Voting;Arizona;Georgia;Nevada;Wisconsin
results.title: When We’ll Know: The Remaining Key Factors in Georgia, Nevada, Arizona
results.abstract: Who will control the Senate and the House? Settle in for a long wait.

media.caption: As happened in the 2020 election, control of the Senate may come down to a Georgia runoff. Senator Raphael Warnock spoke to supporters in Atlanta after climbing into a narrow lead against Herschel Walker.
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Elections, Senate;Midterm Elections (2022);Fetterman, John (1969- );Oz, Mehmet C;Senate;Republican Party;Democratic Party;Pennsylvania
results.title: Fetterman Wins Pennsylvania Senate Race as Democrats Notch Key Win
results.abstract: Lt. Gov. John Fetterman, who said he was fighting for everyone “that ever got knocked down,” defeated Mehmet Oz, the celebrity TV host, after a tumultuous campaign.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, Senate;Warnock, Raphael G;Walker, Herschel;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Trump, Donald J;Georgia
results.title: Warnock and Walker Head to Runoff in Pivotal Georgia Senate Race
results.abstract: The contest between Senator Raphael Warnock, the Democrat, and Herschel Walker, the Republican, is seen as key to which party controls the Senate.

media.caption: Herschel Walker, the Republican candidate for Georgia’s Senate seat, during a campaign event in Savannah in October.
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Elections, House of Representatives;Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Redistricting and Reapportionment;Maloney, Sean Patrick;Lawler, Mike (1986- );Democratic Party;Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee;Republican Party;Hudson River Valley (NY);New York State
results.byline: By Jesse McKinley and Nicholas Fandos
results.title: Sean Patrick Maloney Concedes to Mike Lawler in Major Loss for Democrats
results.abstract: Mr. Maloney, who leads the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee, was seeking to represent a different district after New York’s messy redistricting process.

media.caption: Representative Sean Patrick Maloney, delivering a concession speech on Wednesday, led the Democratic Party’s campaign operation in the House.
media.copyright: Kenny Holston for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Abortion;Referendums;Constitutions;Constitutional Amendments;Midterm Elections (2022);California;Kentucky;Michigan;Vermont;Montana
results.byline: By Mitch Smith and Ava Sasani
results.title: Michigan, California, Vermont Affirm Abortion Rights in State Ballot Proposals
results.abstract: Voters in all three states amended their constitutions to include reproductive rights, while Kentucky voters rejected an amendment that would have said there was no right to the procedure.

media.caption: Abortion-rights supporters in California rallied in Long Beach before Election Day.

results.adx_keywords: Elections, Governors;Midterm Elections (2022);Abrams, Stacey Y;Kemp, Brian P;Republican Party;Democratic Party;Georgia
results.title: Gov. Brian Kemp Wins Re-election in Georgia, Topping Stacey Abrams
results.abstract: Ms. Abrams, a Democrat, bowed to Mr. Kemp, the Republican incumbent, in a rematch of their 2018 race. He had campaigned on his conservative policy wins.

results.adx_keywords: Auctions;Art;Sculpture;Finances;Collectors and Collections;Philanthropy;Allen, Paul G;Botticelli, Sandro;Gauguin, Paul;Manet, Edouard;Seurat, Georges;Christie's;Microsoft Corp
results.title: Paul G. Allen’s Art at Christie’s Tops $1.5 Billion, Cracking Records
results.abstract: A museum’s worth of masterworks from the Microsoft co-founder’s collection are offered in a two-part charity sale. Five topped $100 million.

media.caption: Georges Seurat’s “Les Poseuses Ensemble (Petite version)” (1888) being auctioned during the Paul Allen sale at Christie’s in New York on Wednesday. The sale realized $1 billion with fees at about 8:30 p.m.
media.copyright: Jeenah Moon for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, Senate;Elections, House of Representatives;United States Politics and Government;Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;Republican Party;Democratic Party
results.title: Republicans Gain Ground in Push to Take House as Democrats Hold Off Red Wave
results.abstract: Republicans picked up momentum in their drive for the House majority, but Democrats held crucial seats, dashing projections of a blood bath, and claimed a key Senate seat in Pennsylvania.

media.caption: “We are expanding this party,” Representative Kevin McCarthy, the Republican leader, said at a subdued election night party in Washington.

results.adx_keywords: Exercise;Heart;Content Type: Service;Weight Lifting
results.title: Can You Get a Full-Body Workout in 20 Minutes?
results.abstract: Yes, but you have to pick the right routine.

media.copyright: Eric Helgas for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Lotteries;Taxation;Svitko, Drew;United States;Altadena (Calif);Los Angeles County (Calif)
results.byline: By Remy Tumin, Amanda Holpuch and Johnny Diaz
results.title: $2 Billion Powerball Ticket Sold in Los Angeles County, Lottery Officials Said
results.abstract: The identity of the winner or winners is not yet known, but the California Lottery said it had made its first billionaire. There was a delay in announcing the winning numbers, because of a security issue.

media.caption: The Powerball jackpot grew to $1.9 billion after the drawing Saturday night produced no top prize winner.
